conclusion: Analyze forces acting on the suitcase: gravitational, normal, pulling, and frictional.
Identify gravitational force as 150 N acting downwards.
Identify pulling force as 90 N at angle θ to the horizontal.
Identify frictional force acting opposite to motion.
Resolve pulling force into horizontal (P_x) and vertical (P_y) components.
Apply Newton's second law for horizontal and vertical motion.
Substitute known values into equations for P_x and P_y.
Solve for normal force N as 150 N - 90 N * sin(θ).
Substitute normal force into frictional force equation.
Solve for μ using the equation μ = (90 N * cos(θ)) / (150 N - 90 N * sin(θ)).
Calculate μ as 0.75 using assumed θ.
State that solving for θ requires additional information.
